metadata.dc:author: Llarena Ibarguren, R
Zabala Egurrola, J A
Arruza Echevarría, A
Acha Pérez, M
Pertusa Peña, C
Aguinaga Alesanco, A
metadata.dc:description: The paper reports 2 cases of cystic-pyelocalyceal communication one secondary to traumatism and the other one infection-induced, demonstrating the possibilities of using etiological diagnosis in these communications, and the therapy to be followed. Endoscopic manipulation is usually enough to allow correct diagnosis as well as treatment.
metadata.dc:title: Quistes renales comunicantes con la vía excretora.
[Renal cysts communicating with the excretory duct].
